messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fed-up...mommy memory
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks!  acutally H has an AMAZING memory!  She can tell us about thigns that she/we did long ago.  Like we were driving past a restaurant, around xmas last
messages.messageBody:
Thanks! acutally H has an AMAZING memory! She can tell us
about thigns that she/we did long ago. Like we were driving past
a restaurant, around xmas last year, and she told us that we'd
been there when she was 3 and she'd had prawns (for her
birthday, she was 4 last October...) and then there had been
fireworks, and they were really noisy and she was very scared.
(this is what she told us. It was more than a year before. The
fireworkd were part of a display we saw on the way home for
Guy Fawkes night.)

She asked me about the farm, and whether daddy had been, and I
told her yes, he was there when u got in with the donkeys...

Tracy
PS, it will get better. Honestly, it will. people kept telling me this
and i didn't believe them...
On 20 Jul 2000, at 6:54, Jaam1224@... wrote:

Tracy,
you must have a great memory! I can never remember all
the clever things my 
kids have do. I have to write them down somewhere. It
is amazing what I 
have already forgotten about Ali being a new
toddler....just too many things 
going on I guess.
Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] fed-up...mommy memory
messages.msgSnippet: Tracy, you must have a great memory!  I can never remember all the clever things my kids have do.  I have to write them down somewhere.  It is amazing what I
messages.messageBody:
Tracy,
you must have a great memory! I can never remember all the clever things my
kids have do. I have to write them down somewhere. It is amazing what I
have already forgotten about Ali being a new toddler....just too many things
going on I guess.
Julie
